            Issue 1230530: Security: heap-use-after-free in the PaymentCredential in the browser process
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1230530: Security: heap-use-after-free in the PaymentCredential in the browser process
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      0xasn...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2297871127" title="0xasn...@gmail.com"><!---->0xasn...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      0xasn...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->0xasn...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Mon, Jul 19, 2021, 8:07 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jul 19, 2021, 8:07 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

class="line"><!---->heap-use-after-free in the PaymentCredential in the browser process which will excape the sandbox.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome 10<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Put the confirm.html & confirm.js in the command:<!----></span><br>C:\chromium_version\asan-win32-release_x64-902937>chrome.exe --user-data-dir=c:/tmp/no1 --enable-experimental-web-platform-features <span       </div><br>
    
        
      
        Confirmed that the ASAN build of Chrome 92.0.4515.0 does not have this issue, while Chrome 93.0.4573.0 does.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/60d431517f7a58c313b0de2567213df685fb60ae<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/60d431517f7a58c313b0de2567213df685fb60ae"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/60d431517f7a58c313b0de2567213df685fb60ae<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>60d431517f7a58c313b0de2567213df685fb60ae<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/60d431517f7a58c313b0de2567213df685fb60ae"><!---->60d431517f7a58c313b0de2567213df685fb60ae<!----></a><br>Author: Rouslan Solomakhin <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Rouslan Solomakhin &lt;<!----></span>rouslan@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/rouslan@chromium.org"><!---->rouslan@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jul 20 23:13:50 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jul 20 23:13:50 2021<!----></span><br><br>[SPC] Correctly handle page closing during enrollment.<span class="line"><!---->[SPC] Correctly handle page closing during enrollment.<!----></span><br><br>Before this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<span class="line"><!---->Before this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<!----></span><br>enrollment dialog for SPC was opened would cause a use after free<span class="line"><!---->enrollment dialog for SPC was opened would cause a use after free<!----></span><br>condition in the UI controller, because the UI controller could cause<span class="line"><!---->condition in the UI controller, because the UI controller could cause<!----></span><br>itself to be deleted in the middle of its own CloseDialog() method due<span class="line"><!---->itself to be deleted in the middle of its own CloseDialog() method due<!----></span><br>to re-entrancy.<span class="line"><!---->to re-entrancy.<!----></span><br><br>This patch makes PaymentCredentialEnrollmentController::CloseDialog()<span class="line"><!---->This patch makes PaymentCredentialEnrollmentController::CloseDialog()<!----></span><br>handle re-entry into itself safely.<span class="line"><!---->handle re-entry into itself safely.<!----></span><br><br>After this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<span class="line"><!---->After this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<!----></span><br>enrollment dialog for SPC is opened will not cause a use after free<span class="line"><!---->enrollment dialog for SPC is opened will not cause a use after free<!----></span><br>condition in the UI controller.<span class="line"><!---->condition in the UI controller.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1230530<a class="strike-through" safely.<span class="line"><!---->handle re-entry into itself safely.<!----></span><br><br>After this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<span class="line"><!---->After this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<!----></span><br>enrollment dialog for SPC is opened will not cause a use after free<span class="line"><!---->enrollment dialog for SPC is opened will         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        rouslan@ as you might be aware, Critical security bugs are unusual, so we ask for a post-mortem on each such bug. Would you mind kicking one off? It would be interesting to know what we could have done better to avoid this (e.g. are there areas which should have fuzzing coverage? Could more code be sandboxed? Are there code patterns which should be made more robust to error? etc.)<span class="line"><!---->rouslan@ as you might be aware, Critical security bugs are unusual, so we ask for a post-mortem on each such bug. Would you mind kicking one off? It would be interesting to know what we could have done better to avoid this (e.g. are there areas which should have fuzzing coverage? Could more code be sandboxed? Are there code patterns which should be made more robust to error? etc.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

enrollment.<span class="line"><!---->[SPC] Correctly handle page closing during enrollment.<!----></span><br><br>Before this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<span class="line"><!---->Before this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<!----></span><br>enrollment dialog for SPC was opened would cause a use after free<span class="line"><!---->enrollment dialog for SPC was opened would cause a use after free<!----></span><br>condition in the UI controller, because the UI controller could cause<span class="line"><!---->condition in the UI controller, because the UI controller could cause<!----></span><br>itself to be deleted in the middle of its own CloseDialog() method due<span class="line"><!---->itself to be deleted in the middle of its own CloseDialog() method due<!----></span><br>to re-entrancy.<span class="line"><!---->to re-entrancy.<!----></span><br><br>This patch makes PaymentCredentialEnrollmentController::CloseDialog()<span class="line"><!---->This patch makes PaymentCredentialEnrollmentController::CloseDialog()<!----></span><br>handle re-entry into itself safely.<span class="line"><!---->handle re-entry into itself safely.<!----></span><br><br>After this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<span class="line"><!---->After this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<!----></span><br>enrollment dialog for SPC is opened will not cause a use after free<span class="line"><!---->enrollment dialog for SPC is opened will not cause a use after free<!----></span><br>condition in the UI controller.<span class="line"><!---->condition in the UI controller.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1230530<a class="strike-through" during enrollment.<span class="line"><!---->[Merge M93][SPC] Correctly handle page closing during enrollment.<!----></span><br><br>Before this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<span class="line"><!---->Before this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<!----></span><br>enrollment dialog for SPC was opened would cause a use after free<span safely.<span class="line"><!---->handle re-entry into itself safely.<!----></span><br><br>After this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<span class="line"><!---->After this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<!----></span><br>enrollment dialog for SPC is opened will not cause a use after free<span class="line"><!---->enrollment dialog for SPC is opened will         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money.         rouslan@ as you might be aware, Critical security bugs are unusual, so we ask for a post-mortem on each such bug. Would you mind kicking one off? It would be interesting to know what we could have done better to avoid this (e.g. are there areas which should have fuzzing coverage? Could more code be sandboxed? Are there code patterns which should be made more robust to error? etc.)<span class="line"><!---->rouslan@ as you might be aware, Critical security bugs are unusual, so we ask for a post-mortem on each such bug. Would you mind kicking one off? It would be interesting to know what we could have done better to avoid this (e.g. are there areas which should have fuzzing coverage? Could more code be sandboxed? Are there code patterns which should be made more robust to error? etc.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

enrollment.<span class="line"><!---->[SPC] Correctly handle page closing during enrollment.<!----></span><br><br>Before this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<span class="line"><!---->enrollment dialog for SPC was opened would cause a use after free<!----></span><br>condition in the UI controller, because the UI controller could cause<span safely.<span class="line"><!---->handle re-entry into itself safely.<!----></span><br><br>After this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<span class="line"><!---->After this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<!----></span><br>enrollment dialog for SPC is opened will not cause a use after free<span class="line"><!---->enrollment dialog for SPC is opened will not cause a use after free<!----></span><br>condition in the UI controller.<span class="line"><!---->condition in the UI controller.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1230530<a class="strike-through" during enrollment.<span class="line"><!---->[Merge M93][SPC] Correctly handle page closing during enrollment.<!----></span><br><br>Before this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<span class="line"><!---->Before this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<!----></span><br>enrollment dialog for SPC was opened would cause a use after free<span class="line"><!---->enrollment dialog for SPC was opened would cause a use after free<!----></span><br>condition in the UI controller, because the UI controller could cause<span makes PaymentCredentialEnrollmentController::CloseDialog()<span class="line"><!---->This patch makes PaymentCredentialEnrollmentController::CloseDialog()<!----></span><br>handle re-entry into itself safely.<span class="line"><!---->handle re-entry into itself safely.<!----></span><br><br>After this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<span class="line"><!---->After this patch, closing or reloading the page while the browser<!----></span><br>enrollment dialog for SPC is opened will not cause a use after free<span class="line"><!---->enrollment dialog for SPC is opened will         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        rouslan@ as you might be aware, Critical security bugs are unusual, so we ask for a post-mortem on each such bug. Would you mind kicking one off? It would be interesting to know what we could have done better to avoid this (e.g. are there areas which should have fuzzing coverage? Could more code be sandboxed? Are there code patterns which should be made more robust to error? etc.)<span class="line"><!---->rouslan@ as you might be aware, Critical security bugs are unusual, so we ask for a post-mortem on each such bug. Would you mind kicking one off? It would be interesting to know what we could have done better to avoid this (e.g. are there areas which should have fuzzing coverage? Could more code be sandboxed? Are there code patterns which should be made more robust to error? etc.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    </chops-dialog>

      <div class="snackbar-container" aria-live="polite">
        
      </div>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
